turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Would you order a cappuccino for me to pick up at Starbucks

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: No problem. Which Starbucks?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: The one on the Corner of Fourth & A Streets in San Rafael

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Got it. What size cap do you want?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Order a Venti.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Do you want a single shot or a double?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: I need a triple shot; I'm tired!

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: How about milk? What type do you want?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Do they have low-fat milk?

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Yes, they have 1% or 2% lowfat milk.

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Get me 2% lowfat, please.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Do you want any sweetener in your cap?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Yes, but not sure if I want sugar or honey.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: You don't want honey in coffee. Go with the sugar.

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Okay, ask them for 1 sugar.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Do you want a sprinkle of chocolate or cinnamon on the top?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Absolutely, get me a sprinkle of both.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Okay, so that's a venti cap with 2%, 1 sugar, and a sprinkle of both chocolate and cinnamon. Is that right?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: You got it! Thanks for this!

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: It'll be ready in 20 minutes.

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Great. I'm on my way.
